required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Self-Moxibustion Therapy on Subjective Physical Symptoms and Health-related Quality of Life of the Elderly. The Effects of Self-Moxibustion Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Self-Moxibustion Therapy on Subjective Physical Symptoms and Health-related Quality of Life of the Elderly.

lead_sponsor.agency: Pusan National University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Pusan National University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: There will be significant differences between control and experimental group after the moxibustion intervention as to, subjective physical symptoms and quality of life.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment

arm_group.description: moxibustion treatment 3 times a week for 3 weeks

intervention.description: modernly developed moxibustion treatment device with safe cover on top of it.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female older adults age between 65-85
- Agree to participate and sign for the trail after understanding of study purpose, and method.
- Able to answer for questions by verbally or literally
- Able to participate in 2weeks after follow-up
Exclusion Criteria:
- Having physical disorder such as thyroids, severe heart disease, dietetic mellitus, severe liver disease, allergy
- Subjects who can not attend more than 3 times of intervention session
- Subjects who are eligible by the decision of investigator

overall_official.affiliation: Pusan National University School of Medicine

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Pusan National University School of Korean Medicine
